<h1>Thirsty Giant - India\'s Water Crisis</h1>\n    </div><!-- close subHdr --><div id="topic">\n    <div class="abColumns">   \n                <div class="wideA">\n            <div id="story"><div class="story-meta"><div class="kicker"></div></div></div><!-- switchpoint -->        \n            <div class="aColumn">\n                <div id="ledeModule" class="columnGroup">\n    <div class="callout w395">\n    <img src="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2007/05/07/world/indiawater395.jpg" width="395" height="220" alt=""/>\n    <div class="credit">Ruth Fremson/The New York Times</div>\n</div><!-- close callout -->\n    <div class="summary">Articles in the series examined India\'s growing water crisis amd looked at distribution and sanitation problems in cities and farmers\' wells running dry.</div>\n    <div class="related">\n    Related Links: <a href="http://topics.nytimes.com/top/news/international/countriesandterritories/india/index.html">India</a>    \n    \t  \n</div>\n</div> <!-- end ledeModule -->\n                                        \n                        \n                            \n            \n                \n                                \t\n\t<div id="featuredArticles" class="columnGroup">\n\t<h3></h3>\n\t\t    <div class="story clearfix">\n                    <h6 class="kicker">Thirsty Giant</h6>\n                \n\t        \t    <div class="callout">\n    \t    <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/10/01/world/asia/01india.html">\n    \t    <img src="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2006/10/01/world/01india.75.jpg" alt="Often Parched, India Struggles to Tap the Monsoon" width="75" height="75" border="0">\n    \t    </a>\n    \t    </div><!-- close callout -->\n\t    \t    \n\t    <h4><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/10/01/world/asia/01india.html">Often Parched, India Struggles to Tap the Monsoon</a></h4>\n\t    \n\t    \t        <div class="byline">By SOMINI SENGUPTA</div>\n                \n\t    \t        <p class="summary">Every year, India is crippled by floods in some areas, even as it is parched in blighted corners elsewhere. A solution to the problem is crucial for the country’s future.</p>\n\t    \t    \n\t    \t                \t        <span class="date">October 1, 2006</span>\n                \n        <span class="section">world</span><span class="source">News</span>\n\t    </div><!-- close story clearfix -->\n\t\t    <div class="story clearfix">\n                \n\t    \t    \n\t    <h4><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/10/01/world/asia/01voices.html">The Debate: Water Management, Water Fees and Conservation</a></h4>\n\t    \n\t            \n\t    \t        <p class="summary">Experts agree that demand must be contained, particularly in agriculture, and supply increased.</p>\n\t    \t    \n\t    \t                \t        <span class="date">October 1, 2006</span>\n                \n        <span class="section">world</span><span class="source">News</span>\n\t    </div><!-- close story clearfix -->\n\t\t    <div class="story clearfix">\n                    <h6 class="kicker">Thirsty Giant</h6>\n                \n\t        \t    <div class="callout">\n    \t    <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/30/world/asia/30water2.html">\n    \t    <img src="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2006/09/29/world/30water75.1.jpg" alt="India Digs Deeper, but Wells Are Drying Up" width="75" height="75" border="0">\n    \t    </a>\n    \t    </div><!-- close callout -->\n\t    \t    \n\t    <h4><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/30/world/asia/30water2.html">India Digs Deeper, but Wells Are Drying Up</a></h4>\n\t    \n\t    \t        <div class="byline">By SOMINI SENGUPTA</div>\n                \n\t    \t        <p class="summary">With a driving need to boost agricultural production, Indians are tapping their groundwater faster than nature can replenish it.</p>\n\t    \t    \n\t    \t                \t        <span class="date">September 30, 2006</span>\n                \n        <span class="section">world</span><span class="source">News</span>\n\t    </div><!-- close story clearfix -->\n\t\t    <div class="story clearfix">\n                    <h6 class="kicker">Thirsty Giant</h6>\n                \n\t        \t    <div class="callout">\n    \t    <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/29/world/asia/29water.html">\n    \t    <img src="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2006/09/28/world/29delhi75.1.jpg" alt="In Teeming India, Water Crisis Means Dry Pipes and Foul Sludge" width="75" height="75" border="0">\n    \t    </a>\n    \t    </div><!-- close callout -->\n\t    \t    \n\t    <h4><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/29/world/asia/29water.html">In Teeming India, Water Crisis Means Dry Pipes and Foul Sludge</a></h4>\n\t    \n\t    \t        <div class="byline">By SOMINI SENGUPTA</div>\n                \n\t    \t        <p class="summary">A crisis decades in the making has reduced middle-class people in New Delhi to foraging for water.</p>\n\t    \t    \n\t    \t                \t        <span class="date">September 29, 2006</span>\n                \n        <span class="section">world</span><span class="source">News</span>\n\t    </div><!-- close story clearfix -->\n\t\t\n\t</div><!-- close featuredArticles columnGroup -->\n\t                                \n                        \t        \n                <script type="text/javascript" class="navigation-edge"></div>\n\n        <main id="main" class="main" role="main">\n                <div id="TopAd" class="ad top-ad"></div>\n        <div id="subHdr" class="clearfix">\n        <h1>Thirsty Giant - India\'s Water Crisis</h1>\n    </div><!-- close subHdr --><div id="topic">\n    <div class="abColumns">   \n                <div class="wideA">\n            <div id="story"><div class="story-meta"><div class="kicker"></div></div></div><!-- switchpoint -->        \n            <div class="aColumn">\n                <div id="ledeModule" class="columnGroup">\n    <div class="callout w395">\n    <img src="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2007/05/07/world/indiawater395.jpg" width="395" height="220" alt=""/>\n    <div class="credit">Ruth Fremson/The New York Times</div>\n</div><!-- close callout -->\n    <div class="summary">Articles in the series examined India\'s growing water crisis amd looked at distribution and sanitation problems in cities and farmers\' wells running dry.</div>\n    <div class="related">\n    Related Links: <a href="http://topics.nytimes.com/top/news/international/countriesandterritories/india/index.html">India</a>    \n    \t  \n</div>\n</div> <!-- end ledeModule -->\n                                        \n                        \n                            \n            \n                \n                                \t\n\t<div id="featuredArticles" class="columnGroup">\n\t<h3></h3>\n\t\t    <div class="story clearfix">\n                    <h6 class="kicker">Thirsty Giant</h6>\n                \n\t        \t    <div class="callout">\n    \t    <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/10/01/world/asia/01india.html">\n    \t    <img src="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2006/10/01/world/01india.75.jpg" alt="Often Parched, India Struggles to Tap the Monsoon" width="75" height="75" border="0">\n    \t    </a>\n    \t    </div><!-- close callout -->\n\t    \t    \n\t    <h4><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/10/01/world/asia/01india.html">Often Parched, India Struggles to Tap the Monsoon</a></h4>\n\t    \n\t    \t        <div class="byline">By SOMINI SENGUPTA</div>\n                \n\t    \t        <p class="summary">Every year, India is crippled by floods in some areas, even as it is parched in blighted corners elsewhere. A solution to the problem is crucial for the country’s future.</p>\n\t    \t    \n\t    \t                \t        <span class="date">October 1, 2006</span>\n                \n        <span class="section">world</span><span class="source">News</span>\n\t    </div><!-- close story clearfix -->\n\t\t    <div class="story clearfix">\n                \n\t    \t    \n\t    <h4><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/10/01/world/asia/01voices.html">The Debate: Water Management, Water Fees and Conservation</a></h4>\n\t    \n\t            \n\t    \t        <p class="summary">Experts agree that demand must be contained, particularly in agriculture, and supply increased.</p>\n\t    \t    \n\t    \t                \t        <span class="date">October 1, 2006</span>\n                \n        <span class="section">world</span><span class="source">News</span>\n\t    </div><!-- close story clearfix -->\n\t\t    <div class="story clearfix">\n                    <h6 class="kicker">Thirsty Giant</h6>\n                \n\t        \t    <div class="callout">\n    \t    <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/30/world/asia/30water2.html">\n    \t    <img src="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2006/09/29/world/30water75.1.jpg" alt="India Digs Deeper, but Wells Are Drying Up" width="75" height="75" border="0">\n    \t    </a>\n    \t    </div><!-- close callout -->\n\t    \t    \n\t    <h4><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/30/world/asia/30water2.html">India Digs Deeper, but Wells Are Drying Up</a></h4>\n\t    \n\t    \t        <div class="byline">By SOMINI SENGUPTA</div>\n                \n\t    \t        <p class="summary">With a driving need to boost agricultural production, Indians are tapping their groundwater faster than nature can replenish it.</p>\n\t    \t    \n\t    \t                \t        <span class="date">September 30, 2006</span>\n                \n        <span class="section">world</span><span class="source">News</span>\n\t    </div><!-- close story clearfix -->\n\t\t    <div class="story clearfix">\n                    <h6 class="kicker">Thirsty Giant</h6>\n                \n\t        \t    <div class="callout">\n    \t    <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/29/world/asia/29water.html">\n    \t    <img src="http://static01.nyt.com/images/2006/09/28/world/29delhi75.1.jpg" alt="In Teeming India, Water Crisis Means Dry Pipes and Foul Sludge" width="75" height="75" border="0">\n    \t    </a>\n    \t    </div><!-- close callout -->\n\t    \t    \n\t    <h4><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/29/world/asia/29water.html">In Teeming India, Water Crisis Means Dry Pipes and Foul Sludge</a></h4>\n\t    \n\t    \t        <div class="byline">By SOMINI SENGUPTA</div>\n                \n\t    \t        <p class="summary">A crisis decades in the making has reduced middle-class people in New Delhi to foraging for water.</p>\n\t    \t    \n\t    \t                \t        <span class="date">September 29, 2006</span>\n                \n        <span class="section">world</span><span class="source">News</span>\n\t    </div><!-- close story clearfix class="clearfix">\n<div id="breadcrumb">\n<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/pages/health/index.html">Health</a> &gt; \t\t\n\t\t<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/index.html">Times Health Guide</a> &gt;\t\t\n\t\t<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/index.html?letter=m">m</a> &gt; \n\t\t\t<span class="current">Macular Degeneration - Age-Related</span><div class="clear"></div>\n</div>\n<h1>Macular Degeneration - Age-Related</h1>\n</div>\n<div class="aColumn">\n<ul id="leftNav">\n<li class="first selected">Overview<ul>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#Alternative-Names">Alternative Names</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#Causes">Causes</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#Symptoms">Symptoms</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#Treatment">Treatment</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#Support-Groups">Support Groups</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#Prevention">Prevention</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#References">References</a></li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/news-and-features.html">News & Features</a></li>\n</ul>\n<div class="columnGroup columnGroupborderTop" id="multimedia">\n<h3>Multimedia</h3>\n<div class="story first clearfix"><h5><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2011/07/13/health/healthguide/macular-degeneration-voices.html">Patient Voices: Macular Degeneration</a></h5></div>\n<!-- end .story clearfix --><div class="story clearfix">\n<div class="callout media"><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2011/07/13/health/healthguide/macular-degeneration-voices.html"><img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com//images/2011/07/11/health/macular_degeneration/macular_degeneration-thumbWide.jpg" alt="Patient Voices: Macular Degeneration " border="0" width="190"></a></div>\n<h5><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2011/07/13/health/healthguide/macular-degeneration-voices.html">Patient Voices: Macular Degeneration </a></h5>\n</div>\n<!-- end .story clearfix --><div class="story first clearfix">\n<div class="callout media">\n<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2011/07/13/health/healthguide/macular-degeneration-voices.html"><img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/images/2011/07/11/health/macular_degeneration/macular_degeneration-thumbWide.jpg" alt="" width="190" height="126" border="0"></a><span class="mediaType interactive">Interactive Feature</span>\n</div>\n<h5><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2011/07/13/health/healthguide/macular-degeneration-voices.html">Patient Voices: Macular Degeneration</a></h5>\n</div>\n<div class="story clearfix" id="adamMM">\n<div class="kicker">MORE MULTIMEDIA</div>\n<ul class="refer"><li><a href="javascript:pop_me_up2(\'http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2007/08/01/health/ADAM_MACDEG_FEATURE.html\',\'600475\',\'width=600,height=475,location=no,scrollbars=yes,toolbars=no,resizable=yes\')">Macular Degeneration</a></li></ul>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class="bColumn">\n<div id="definition"><p>Macular degeneration is an eye disorder that slowly destroys sharp, central vision. This makes it difficult to see fine details and read.</p>\n  <p>The disease is most common in people over age 60, which is why it is often called age-related macular degeneration (ARMD, or AMD).</p></div>\n<div id="timesTopic"><div class="story clearfix">\n<h3 class="TE">Times Essentials</h3>\n<p class="aboutTE">Recent findings and perspectives on medical research.</p>\n<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/13/health/13eyes.html"><img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/images/2008/05/13/health/eye_190_126.jpg" alt="Care of the Eyes Demands Diligence" height="126" width="190" border="0" class="callout"></a><div class="rightCol"><div class="kicker">Eyes</div>\n<h2><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/13/health/13eyes.html">Care of the Eyes Demands Diligence</a></h2>\n<div class="byline">By NICHOLAS BAKALAR</div>\n<p class="summary">Regular exams are essential for uncovering glaucoma and other diseases that may otherwise remain undetected until they cause serious vision problems.</p></div><div class="clear"></div></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup"><div class="story clearfix">\n<div class="kicker">\n<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/news-and-features.html">See All »</a>\n\t\t\t\tNews &amp; Features\n\t\t\t</div>\n<ul class="refer">\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/21/business/eylea-a-vision-drug-wins-long-sought-approval.html">Success Long in Coming for Eylea, a Vision Treatment</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/21/business/eylea-a-vision-drug-wins-long-sought-approval.html">Eylea, a Vision Drug, Wins Long-Sought Approval</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9B07EFDE1F31F936A35753C1A9679D8B63">Risk Reports Chill the Use of a Cheaper Eye Drug</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/08/31/health/31drug.html">Avastin Injections Are Reported to Cause Blindness</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/08/31/health/31drug.html">Avastin Injections Are Said to Cause Blindness</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/07/19/health/views/19macular.html">Adapting as Vision and Independence Ebb</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/07/19/health/views/19macular.html">Adapting as Vision and Independence Ebb</a></li>\n<li><a href="/data/daily/2011/06/18/769240.sgml">F.D.A. Panel Endorses an Eye Treatment</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/05/17/opinion/17tue2.html">The Value of Comparison</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/05/17/opinion/17tue2.html">The Value of Comparison</a></li>\n</ul>\n</div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup columnGroupborderTop "><div class="story clearfix">\n<div class="kicker">Reference from A.D.A.M.</div><h3 id="Alternative-Names"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>Alternative Names</h3>\n<p>Age-related macular degeneration (ARMD); AMD</p></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup "><div class="story clearfix"><h3 id="Causes"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>Causes</h3>\n<p>The retina is at the back of the eye. It changes light and images that enter the eye into nerve signals that are sent to the brain. A part of the retina called the macula makes vision sharper and more detailed.</p>\n  <p>AMD is caused by damage to the blood vessels that supply the macula. This change also harms the macula.</p>\n  <p>There are two types of AMD:</p>\n  <ul>\n    <li>\n      <em>Dry AMD</em>\n      occurs when the blood vessels under the macula become thin and brittle. Small yellow deposits, called drusen, form. Almost all people with macular degeneration start with the dry form.\n    </li>\n    <li>\n      <em>Wet AMD</em>\n      occurs in about 10% of people with macular degeneration. New abnormal and very fragile blood vessels grow under the macula. These vessels leak blood and fluid. This&#160;type of AMD&#160;causes most of the vision loss associated with the condition.\n    </li>\n  </ul>\n  <p>Doctors&#160;are not sure what causes AMD. The condition is rare before age 55. It occurs most in&#160;persons 75 years or older.</p>\n  <p>Risk factors for AMD are:</p>\n  <ul>\n    <li>Family history of AMD</li>\n    <li>Being caucasian</li>\n    <li>Cigarette smoking</li>\n    <li>High-fat diet</li>\n    <li>Being a woman</li>\n  </ul></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup "><div class="story clearfix"><h3 id="Symptoms"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>Symptoms</h3>\n<p>You may not have any symptoms at first. As the disease gets worse, you may have problems with your central vision.</p>\n  <p>SYMPTOMS OF DRY AMD</p>\n  <p>The most common symptom&#160;of dry AMD is blurred vision. Objects in the center part of your vision often look distorted and dim, and colors look faded. You may have trouble reading print or seeing other details. But you can see well enough to walk and&#160;do most daily activities.</p>\n  <p>As&#160;dry AMD gets&#160;worse, you may need more light to read or&#160;do everyday tasks. A blurred spot in the center of vision gradually gets larger and darker.</p>\n  <p>In the later stages of dry AMD, you may not be able to recognize faces until they are close.</p>\n  <p>SYMPTOMS OF WET AMD</p>\n  <p>The most common early symptom of wet AMD is that straight lines&#160;look distorted and wavy.</p>\n  <p>There may be a small dark spot in the center of your vision that gets larger over time.</p>\n  <p>With both types of AMD, central vision loss can occur quickly. If this happens, you will need&#160;to be seen&#160;right away&#160;by an ophthalmologist. Make sure this eye doctor has experience in treating problems with the retina.</p></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup "><div class="story clearfix"><h3 id="Treatment"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>Treatment</h3>\n<p>If you have advanced or severe dry AMD, no treatment can restore your vision.</p>\n  <p>If you have early AMD and do not smoke, a combination of certain vitamins, antioxidants, and zinc may prevent the disease from getting worse. But it cannot give you back vision that is already lost.</p>\n  <p>The combination is often called the "AREDS" formula. The supplements contain:</p>\n  <ul>\n    <li>500 milligrams of vitamin C</li>\n    <li>400 international units of beta-carotene</li>\n    <li>80 milligrams of zinc</li>\n    <li>2 milligrams of copper</li>\n  </ul>\n  <p>Only take this vitamin combination if your doctor recommends it. Make sure your doctor knows about any other vitamins or supplements you are taking. Smokers should&#160;not use this supplement.</p>\n  <p>AREDS may also benefit you if you have a family history and risk factors for AMD.</p>\n  <p>The supplements lutein and zeaxanthin may also be helpful, although they are not part of the AREDS formula.</p>\n  <p>If you have wet AMD, your doctor may recommend:</p>\n  <ul>\n    <li>Laser surgery (laser photocoagulation) -- a small beam of light destroys the leaking, abnormal blood vessels.</li>\n    <li>Photodynamic therapy -- a light activates a drug that is injected into your body to destroy leaking blood vessels.</li>\n    <li>Special medicines that prevent new blood vessels from forming in the eye are injected into the eye (this is a painless process).</li>\n  </ul>\n  <p>Low-vision aids (such as special lenses) and therapy can help you use the vision that you have more effectively, and improve your quality of life.</p>\n  <p>Close follow-up with your eye doctor is important.</p>\n  <ul>\n    <li>For dry AMD, visit your eye doctor once a year for a complete eye exam.</li>\n    <li>For wet AMD, you likely&#160;need frequent, perhaps monthly, follow-up visits.</li>\n  </ul>\n  <p>Early detection of vision changes is important because the sooner you are treated, the better&#160;your outcome. Early detection leads to earlier treatment and often, a better outcome.</p>\n  <p>The best way to detect changes is by self-testing at home with&#160;the Amsler grid. Your eye doctor can give you a copy of the grid. Or you can print one from the Internet. Test each eye individually while wearing&#160;your reading glasses. If the lines look wavy, call your eye doctor right away for an appointment.</p></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup "><div class="story clearfix"><h3 id="Support-Groups"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>Support Groups</h3>\n<p>AMD Alliance International |&#160;www.amdalliance.org</p>\n  <p>Macular Degeneration Association | macularhope.org</p>\n  <p>Macular Degeneration Partnership | www.amd.org</p></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup "><div class="story clearfix"><h3 id="Prevention"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>Prevention</h3>\n<p>Although there is no known way to prevent macular degeneration, leading a healthy lifestyle can reduce your risk of developing AMD:</p>\n  <ul>\n    <li>Do not&#160;smoke</li>\n    <li>Maintain a healthy diet that is high in fruits and vegetables and low in animal fat</li>\n    <li>Exercise regularly</li>\n    <li>Maintain a healthy weight</li>\n  </ul>\n  <p>See your eye care professional regularly for dilated eye exams.</p></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup "><div class="story clearfix"><h3 id="References"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>References</h3>\n<p>American Academy of Ophthalmology Retina Panel. Preferred Practice Pattern Guidelines. Age-related macular degeneration. Updated October 2011. San Francisco, Ca: American Academy of Ophthalmology. Accessed August 29, 2013.</p>\n  <p>\n    Benson WE. Acquired macular disease. In: Tasman W, Jaeger EA, eds.\n    <em>Duane\'s Ophthalmology on DVD-ROM - 2013 Edition</em>\n    ed. Philadelphia, Pa: Lippincott Williams & Wilkins; 2013: vol 3, chap 23.\n  </p>\n  <p>\n    Rosenfeld PJ, Martidis A, Tennant MTS. Age-related macular degeneration. In: Yanoff M, Duker JS, Augsburger JJ, eds.\n    <em>Ophthalmology</em>\n    . 3rd ed. Philadelphia, Pa: Elsevier Mosby; 2008:chap 6.27.\n     \n  </p></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup columnGroupborderTop clearfix"><div class="story clearfix">\n<div class="kicker">More Information on This Topic</div>\n<ul id="moreInfo"><li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/news-and-features.html" class="last">News & Features</a></li></ul>\n</div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup"><div class="story clearfix"><div class="byline copyRights">Review Date: 8/24/2013<br>Reviewed By: Franklin W.            </script>\n</form>\n<form method="POST" style="padding:0; border:0; margin:0" enctype="application/x-www-form-urlencoded" action="https://myaccount.nytimes.com/membercenter/feedback.html" class="clearfix">\n<div id="breadcrumb">\n<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/pages/health/index.html">Health</a> &gt; \t\t\n\t\t<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/index.html">Times Health Guide</a> &gt;\t\t\n\t\t<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/index.html?letter=m">m</a> &gt; \n\t\t\t<span class="current">Macular Degeneration - Age-Related</span><div class="clear"></div>\n</div>\n<h1>Macular Degeneration - Age-Related</h1>\n</div>\n<div class="aColumn">\n<ul id="leftNav">\n<li class="first selected">Overview<ul>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#Alternative-Names">Alternative Names</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#Causes">Causes</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#Symptoms">Symptoms</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#Treatment">Treatment</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#Support-Groups">Support Groups</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#Prevention">Prevention</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/overview.html#References">References</a></li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/news-and-features.html">News & Features</a></li>\n</ul>\n<div class="columnGroup columnGroupborderTop" id="multimedia">\n<h3>Multimedia</h3>\n<div class="story first clearfix"><h5><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2011/07/13/health/healthguide/macular-degeneration-voices.html">Patient Voices: Macular Degeneration</a></h5></div>\n<!-- end .story clearfix --><div class="story clearfix">\n<div class="callout media"><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2011/07/13/health/healthguide/macular-degeneration-voices.html"><img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com//images/2011/07/11/health/macular_degeneration/macular_degeneration-thumbWide.jpg" alt="Patient Voices: Macular Degeneration " border="0" width="190"></a></div>\n<h5><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2011/07/13/health/healthguide/macular-degeneration-voices.html">Patient Voices: Macular Degeneration </a></h5>\n</div>\n<!-- end .story clearfix --><div class="story first clearfix">\n<div class="callout media">\n<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2011/07/13/health/healthguide/macular-degeneration-voices.html"><img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/images/2011/07/11/health/macular_degeneration/macular_degeneration-thumbWide.jpg" alt="" width="190" height="126" border="0"></a><span class="mediaType interactive">Interactive Feature</span>\n</div>\n<h5><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2011/07/13/health/healthguide/macular-degeneration-voices.html">Patient Voices: Macular Degeneration</a></h5>\n</div>\n<div class="story clearfix" id="adamMM">\n<div class="kicker">MORE MULTIMEDIA</div>\n<ul class="refer"><li><a href="javascript:pop_me_up2(\'http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2007/08/01/health/ADAM_MACDEG_FEATURE.html\',\'600475\',\'width=600,height=475,location=no,scrollbars=yes,toolbars=no,resizable=yes\')">Macular Degeneration</a></li></ul>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class="bColumn">\n<div id="definition"><p>Macular degeneration is an eye disorder that slowly destroys sharp, central vision. This makes it difficult to see fine details and read.</p>\n  <p>The disease is most common in people over age 60, which is why it is often called age-related macular degeneration (ARMD, or AMD).</p></div>\n<div id="timesTopic"><div class="story clearfix">\n<h3 class="TE">Times Essentials</h3>\n<p class="aboutTE">Recent findings and perspectives on medical research.</p>\n<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/13/health/13eyes.html"><img src="http://graphics8.nytimes.com/images/2008/05/13/health/eye_190_126.jpg" alt="Care of the Eyes Demands Diligence" height="126" width="190" border="0" class="callout"></a><div class="rightCol"><div class="kicker">Eyes</div>\n<h2><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/13/health/13eyes.html">Care of the Eyes Demands Diligence</a></h2>\n<div class="byline">By NICHOLAS BAKALAR</div>\n<p class="summary">Regular exams are essential for uncovering glaucoma and other diseases that may otherwise remain undetected until they cause serious vision problems.</p></div><div class="clear"></div></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup"><div class="story clearfix">\n<div class="kicker">\n<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/news-and-features.html">See All »</a>\n\t\t\t\tNews &amp; Features\n\t\t\t</div>\n<ul class="refer">\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/21/business/eylea-a-vision-drug-wins-long-sought-approval.html">Success Long in Coming for Eylea, a Vision Treatment</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/21/business/eylea-a-vision-drug-wins-long-sought-approval.html">Eylea, a Vision Drug, Wins Long-Sought Approval</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9B07EFDE1F31F936A35753C1A9679D8B63">Risk Reports Chill the Use of a Cheaper Eye Drug</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/08/31/health/31drug.html">Avastin Injections Are Reported to Cause Blindness</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/08/31/health/31drug.html">Avastin Injections Are Said to Cause Blindness</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/07/19/health/views/19macular.html">Adapting as Vision and Independence Ebb</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/07/19/health/views/19macular.html">Adapting as Vision and Independence Ebb</a></li>\n<li><a href="/data/daily/2011/06/18/769240.sgml">F.D.A. Panel Endorses an Eye Treatment</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/05/17/opinion/17tue2.html">The Value of Comparison</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2011/05/17/opinion/17tue2.html">The Value of Comparison</a></li>\n</ul>\n</div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup columnGroupborderTop "><div class="story clearfix">\n<div class="kicker">Reference from A.D.A.M.</div><h3 id="Alternative-Names"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>Alternative Names</h3>\n<p>Age-related macular degeneration (ARMD); AMD</p></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup "><div class="story clearfix"><h3 id="Causes"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>Causes</h3>\n<p>The retina is at the back of the eye. It changes light and images that enter the eye into nerve signals that are sent to the brain. A part of the retina called the macula makes vision sharper and more detailed.</p>\n  <p>AMD is caused by damage to the blood vessels that supply the macula. This change also harms the macula.</p>\n  <p>There are two types of AMD:</p>\n  <ul>\n    <li>\n      <em>Dry AMD</em>\n      occurs when the blood vessels under the macula become thin and brittle. Small yellow deposits, called drusen, form. Almost all people with macular degeneration start with the dry form.\n    </li>\n    <li>\n      <em>Wet AMD</em>\n      occurs in about 10% of people with macular degeneration. New abnormal and very fragile blood vessels grow under the macula. These vessels leak blood and fluid. This&#160;type of AMD&#160;causes most of the vision loss associated with the condition.\n    </li>\n  </ul>\n  <p>Doctors&#160;are not sure what causes AMD. The condition is rare before age 55. It occurs most in&#160;persons 75 years or older.</p>\n  <p>Risk factors for AMD are:</p>\n  <ul>\n    <li>Family history of AMD</li>\n    <li>Being caucasian</li>\n    <li>Cigarette smoking</li>\n    <li>High-fat diet</li>\n    <li>Being a woman</li>\n  </ul></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup "><div class="story clearfix"><h3 id="Symptoms"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>Symptoms</h3>\n<p>You may not have any symptoms at first. As the disease gets worse, you may have problems with your central vision.</p>\n  <p>SYMPTOMS OF DRY AMD</p>\n  <p>The most common symptom&#160;of dry AMD is blurred vision. Objects in the center part of your vision often look distorted and dim, and colors look faded. You may have trouble reading print or seeing other details. But you can see well enough to walk and&#160;do most daily activities.</p>\n  <p>As&#160;dry AMD gets&#160;worse, you may need more light to read or&#160;do everyday tasks. A blurred spot in the center of vision gradually gets larger and darker.</p>\n  <p>In the later stages of dry AMD, you may not be able to recognize faces until they are close.</p>\n  <p>SYMPTOMS OF WET AMD</p>\n  <p>The most common early symptom of wet AMD is that straight lines&#160;look distorted and wavy.</p>\n  <p>There may be a small dark spot in the center of your vision that gets larger over time.</p>\n  <p>With both types of AMD, central vision loss can occur quickly. If this happens, you will need&#160;to be seen&#160;right away&#160;by an ophthalmologist. Make sure this eye doctor has experience in treating problems with the retina.</p></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup "><div class="story clearfix"><h3 id="Treatment"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>Treatment</h3>\n<p>If you have advanced or severe dry AMD, no treatment can restore your vision.</p>\n  <p>If you have early AMD and do not smoke, a combination of certain vitamins, antioxidants, and zinc may prevent the disease from getting worse. But it cannot give you back vision that is already lost.</p>\n  <p>The combination is often called the "AREDS" formula. The supplements contain:</p>\n  <ul>\n    <li>500 milligrams of vitamin C</li>\n    <li>400 international units of beta-carotene</li>\n    <li>80 milligrams of zinc</li>\n    <li>2 milligrams of copper</li>\n  </ul>\n  <p>Only take this vitamin combination if your doctor recommends it. Make sure your doctor knows about any other vitamins or supplements you are taking. Smokers should&#160;not use this supplement.</p>\n  <p>AREDS may also benefit you if you have a family history and risk factors for AMD.</p>\n  <p>The supplements lutein and zeaxanthin may also be helpful, although they are not part of the AREDS formula.</p>\n  <p>If you have wet AMD, your doctor may recommend:</p>\n  <ul>\n    <li>Laser surgery (laser photocoagulation) -- a small beam of light destroys the leaking, abnormal blood vessels.</li>\n    <li>Photodynamic therapy -- a light activates a drug that is injected into your body to destroy leaking blood vessels.</li>\n    <li>Special medicines that prevent new blood vessels from forming in the eye are injected into the eye (this is a painless process).</li>\n  </ul>\n  <p>Low-vision aids (such as special lenses) and therapy can help you use the vision that you have more effectively, and improve your quality of life.</p>\n  <p>Close follow-up with your eye doctor is important.</p>\n  <ul>\n    <li>For dry AMD, visit your eye doctor once a year for a complete eye exam.</li>\n    <li>For wet AMD, you likely&#160;need frequent, perhaps monthly, follow-up visits.</li>\n  </ul>\n  <p>Early detection of vision changes is important because the sooner you are treated, the better&#160;your outcome. Early detection leads to earlier treatment and often, a better outcome.</p>\n  <p>The best way to detect changes is by self-testing at home with&#160;the Amsler grid. Your eye doctor can give you a copy of the grid. Or you can print one from the Internet. Test each eye individually while wearing&#160;your reading glasses. If the lines look wavy, call your eye doctor right away for an appointment.</p></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup "><div class="story clearfix"><h3 id="Support-Groups"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>Support Groups</h3>\n<p>AMD Alliance International |&#160;www.amdalliance.org</p>\n  <p>Macular Degeneration Association | macularhope.org</p>\n  <p>Macular Degeneration Partnership | www.amd.org</p></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup "><div class="story clearfix"><h3 id="Prevention"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>Prevention</h3>\n<p>Although there is no known way to prevent macular degeneration, leading a healthy lifestyle can reduce your risk of developing AMD:</p>\n  <ul>\n    <li>Do not&#160;smoke</li>\n    <li>Maintain a healthy diet that is high in fruits and vegetables and low in animal fat</li>\n    <li>Exercise regularly</li>\n    <li>Maintain a healthy weight</li>\n  </ul>\n  <p>See your eye care professional regularly for dilated eye exams.</p></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup "><div class="story clearfix"><h3 id="References"><a href="#top" class="backToTop">Back to Top</a>References</h3>\n<p>American Academy of Ophthalmology Retina Panel. Preferred Practice Pattern Guidelines. Age-related macular degeneration. Updated October 2011. San Francisco, Ca: American Academy of Ophthalmology. Accessed August 29, 2013.</p>\n  <p>\n    Benson WE. Acquired macular disease. In: Tasman W, Jaeger EA, eds.\n    <em>Duane\'s Ophthalmology on DVD-ROM - 2013 Edition</em>\n    ed. Philadelphia, Pa: Lippincott Williams & Wilkins; 2013: vol 3, chap 23.\n  </p>\n  <p>\n    Rosenfeld PJ, Martidis A, Tennant MTS. Age-related macular degeneration. In: Yanoff M, Duker JS, Augsburger JJ, eds.\n    <em>Ophthalmology</em>\n    . 3rd ed. Philadelphia, Pa: Elsevier Mosby; 2008:chap 6.27.\n     \n  </p></div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup columnGroupborderTop clearfix"><div class="story clearfix">\n<div class="kicker">More Information on This Topic</div>\n<ul id="moreInfo"><li><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/health/guides/disease/macular-degeneration/news-and-features.html" class="last">News & Features</a></li></ul>\n</div></div>\n<div class="columnGroup"><div class="story clearfix"><div class="byline copyRights">Review Date: 8/24/2013<br>Reviewed By: Franklin W. Lusby, MD, Ophthalmologist, Lusby Vision Institute, La Jolla, California. Also reviewed by David Zieve, MD, MHA, Bethanne Black, and the A.D.A.M.
